intro: Capanemia adelaidae, commonly known as the Adelaide caper, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowering period occurs during the cooler months, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
